page.title: 15Characteristics of the River
page.content: The Severn here is not a river to be treated lightly:the currents are strong and its undertows notorious having claimed many lives of swimmers,capsized boatmen and walkers on the sandbanks which appear at low tide but which are quickly engulfed by rising tides.Deep mud,areas of sinking sand and changing contours of the river bed all add to its dangers but,respected and understood,it can give boatsmen and walkers pleasure and profit.Swimming is never advised.In recent memory the river has frozen over,enabling people to walk across it but this is very rare.It has also,in very dry summers,dropped to such a low level that people with a sound knowledge of the river bed have been able to walk across to the other bank but visitors and less knowledgeable people are ill-advised to try this.
